intro: Enkianthus latiflorus, commonly known as the broad-flower enkianthus, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are elliptical and dark green, providing a lush backdrop to its showy blooms. Enkianthus latiflorus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to add visual interest to woodland gardens.
